RegisterGroup.name: ioshare_10
RegisterGroup.description: a multiplexing control register for the NF_WEN pin.

Member.name: ioctrl_10_DS
Member.description:
Drive capability
3.3 V I/O voltage
0000: 36 mA
0001: 34 mA
0010: 32 mA
0011: 30 mA
0100: 26 mA
0101: 24 mA
0110: 22 mA
0111: 20 mA
1000: 18 mA
1001: 16 mA
1010: 14 mA
1011: 12 mA
1100: 10 mA
1101: 8 mA
1110: 6 mA
1111: 4 mA
1.8 V I/O voltage
0000: 18 mA
0001: 17 mA
0010: 16 mA
0011: 15 mA
0100: 13 mA
0101: 12 mA
0110: 11 mA
0111: 10 mA
1000: 9 mA
1001: 8 mA
1010: 7 mA
1011: 6 mA
1100: 4 mA
1101: 3 mA
1110: 2 mA
1111: 1 mA
When this pin is multiplexed as the NF_WEN function:
If the async NAND flash is connected:
The value 1101 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB.
The value 1110 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB.
If the sync NAND flash is connected:
For the 3.3 V I/O voltage:
The value 1101 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB.
The value 1110 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB.
For the 1.8 V I/O voltage:
The value 1011 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB.
The value 1011 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB.
When this pin is multiplexed as the SDIO2_CCLK_OUT function:
If the 3.3 V I/O voltage is used:
The value 1101 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB.
The value 1110 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB.
If the eMMC 5.0 component is connected and the 1.8 V I/O voltage is used:
If the clock frequency is 100 MHz:
The value 1000 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB.
The value 1001 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB.
If the clock frequency is 150 MHz:
The value 0110 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB.
The value 0111 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB.
The value 1111 is recommended for other scenarios.

Member.name: ioctrl_10_SR
Member.description:
Slew rate control enable
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ioctrl_10_PD
Member.description:
Output pull-down enable
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ioctrl_10_PU
Member.description:
Input pull-up enable
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.description:
NF_WEN pin multiplexing control

1111: 4 mA

0000: 18 mA
0001: 17 mA
0010: 16 mA

0100: 13 mA
0101: 12 mA
0110: 11 mA
0111: 10 mA
1000: 9 mA
1001: 8 mA
1010: 7 mA
1011: 6 mA
1100: 4 mA
1101: 3 mA
1110: 2 mA
1111: 1 mA
When this pin is multiplexed as the TSO0_D5 function, the value 1110 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB.
When this pin is multiplexed as the SDIO1_CCLK_OUT function:
The value 1011 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB.
The value 1100 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB.
If the SDIO 3.0 component is connected, and the SDIO1_CLK frequency is 200 MHz on a single edge:
The value 0000 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB.
The value 0001 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB.

0: disabled
1: enabled
When this pin is multiplexed as the SDIO1_CCLK_OUT function, the SDIO 3.0 component is connected, and the SDIO1_CLK frequency is 200 MHz on a single edge, the value 0 is recommended.
The value 1 is recommended for other scenarios.

100: 5 mA
101: 4 mA
110: 2 mA

When this pin is multiplexed as the TSO0_CLK function:
For the 4-layer PCB:
The value 100 is recommended when it works as the serial TS clock.
The value 101 is recommended when it works as the parallel TS clock.
For the 2-layer PCB:
The value 101 is recommended when it works as the serial TS clock.
The value 110 is recommended when it works as the parallel TS clock.
When this pin is multiplexed as the SDIO1_CCMD function, the value 110 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB.
If the SDIO 3.0 component is connected, and the SDIO1_CLK frequency is 200 MHz on a single edge:
The value 010 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB.
The value 011 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB.
The value 111 is recommended for other scenarios.

The value 10 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB.

When this pin is multiplexed as the I2S1_BCLK function:
For the 3.3 V I/O voltage:
The value 100 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB.
The value 111 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB.
For the 1.8 V I/O voltage:
The value 010 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB.
The value 110 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB.
When this pin is multiplexed as the RGMII0_TXD1 function:
The value 001 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB.
The value 011 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB.
The value 111 is recommended for other scenarios.

Member.name: otp_ctrl_vdac
Member.description:
Enable of four VDAC channels
Bits 15?12 correspond to channels 3?0 respectively.
When the OTP value is 0, channels are controlled by the VDP register by default.
When the OTP value is 1, the enable bit of the corresponding channel is forcibly set to 0, that is, the channel is forcibly powered off.

RegisterGroup.name: SC_LOCKEN
RegisterGroup.description:
a write protection control register. This register provides a write protection mechanism for the following key registers of the system controller:
  • SC_CTRLSC_SYSRES

Member.name: sc_locken
Member.description:
Write protection indicator for key system registers. The configuration is as follows:
When the value 0x4F50_454E is written to SC_LOCKEN, write protection for the preceding key registers is enabled. The attributes of the key registers are changed to writable, that is, these registers can be written.
When any value except 0x4F50_454E is written to SC_LOCKEN, the attributes of the key register are changed to read-only. In this case, writing to these registers has no effect.
You can check whether the key registers are write-protected by reading SC_LOCKEN. For example, if the value 0x756E_4C4F is returned, write protection is disabled, and you can write to the key registers; if the value 0x4C4F_434B is returned, write protection is enabled, and writing to these registers has no effect.
The reset value of SC_LOCKEN is 0x756E_4C4F, indicating that the key registers are not write-protected.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_DATA
RegisterGroup.description:
a GPIO data register. It is used to buffer the input or output data.When the corresponding bit of GPIO_DIR is configured as output, the values written to GPIO_DATA are output to the corresponding pin (ensure that the configuration of pin multiplexing is correct). If the bit is configured as input, the value of the corresponding input pin is read.CAUTIONWhen the corresponding bits of GPIO_DIR are set to inputs, the pin values are returned if the read operation is valid. When the corresponding bits are set to outputs, the written values are returned if the read operation is valid.The GPIO_DATA register masks the read and write operations on bits by using PADDR[9:2]. This register corresponds to 256 address spaces. PADDR[9:2] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0]. When a PADDR bit is high, the corresponding bit in GPIO_DATA can be read or written; when the corresponding bit is low, the read or write operation is not allowed. For example:
  • If the address is 0x3FC (0b11_1111_1100), operations on all the eight bits of GPIO_DATA[7:0] are valid.
  • If the address is 0x200 (0b10_0000_0000), only the operation on GPIO_DATA[7] is valid.

Member.name: gpio_data
Member.description:
GPIO input data when the GPIO is configured as input or GPIO output data when the GPIO is configured as output
Each bit can be separately controlled. This register works with GPIO_DIR.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_DIR
RegisterGroup.description: a GPIO direction control register. It is used to configure the direction of each GPIO pin.

Member.name: gpio_dir
Member.description:
GPIO direction control
Bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively. Each bit can be separately controlled.
0: input
1: output

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_IS
RegisterGroup.description: a GPIO interrupt trigger mode register. It is used to configure the interrupt trigger mode.

Member.name: gpio_is
Member.description:
GPIO interrupt trigger mode. Bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively. Each bit can be separately controlled.
0: edge-sensitive mode
1: level-sensitive mode

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_IBE
RegisterGroup.description: a GPIO interrupt edge trigger register. It is used to configure the edge trigger mode of each GPIO pin.

Member.name: gpio_ibe
Member.description:
GPIO interrupt edge control. Bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively. Each bit can be separately controlled.
0: single-edge-sensitive mode. GPIO_IEV controls whether the interrupt is rising-edge-sensitive or falling-edge-sensitive.
1: dual-edge-sensitive mode

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_IEV
RegisterGroup.description: a GPIO interrupt trigger event register. It is used to configure the interrupt trigger event of a GPIO pin.

Member.name: gpio_iev
Member.description:
GPIO interrupt trigger event. Bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively. Each bit can be separately controlled.
0: The interrupt is triggered by the falling edge or low level.
1: The interrupt is triggered by the rising edge or high level.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_IE
RegisterGroup.description: a GPIO interrupt mask register. It is used to mask GPIO interrupts.

Member.name: gpio_ie
Member.description:
GPIO interrupt mask. Bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively. Each bit can be separately controlled.
0: masked
1: not masked

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_RIS
RegisterGroup.description: a GPIO raw interrupt status register. It is used to query the raw interrupt status of each GPIO pin.

Member.name: gpio_ris
Member.description:
GPIO raw interrupt status. Bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively, indicating the unmasked interrupt status. This status is not under the mask control of the GPIO_IE register.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_MIS
RegisterGroup.description: a GPIO masked interrupt status register. It is used to query the masked interrupt status of each GPIO pin.

Member.name: gpio_mis
Member.description:
GPIO masked interrupt status. Bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively, indicating the masked interrupt status. This status can be masked and controlled by the GPIO_IE register.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_IC
RegisterGroup.description: a GPIO interrupt clear register. It is used to clear the GPIO_RIS and GPIO_MIS registers and interrupts generated by GPIO pins.

Member.name: gpio_ic
Member.description:
GPIO interrupt clear. Bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively. Each bit can be separately controlled.
0: no effect
1: cleared

RegisterGroup.name: I2C_SCL_H
RegisterGroup.description: an I2C SCL high-level cycle count register. It is used to configure the number of SCL high-level cycles when the I2C module is working.CAUTIONDuring or before system initialization, set I2C_CTRL bit[7] to 0.

Member.name: scl_h
Member.description: Number of SCL high-level cycles. The actual number of SCL high-level cycles is the configured value plus 1 and then multiplied by 2.

RegisterGroup.name: I2C_SCL_L
RegisterGroup.description: an I2C SCL low-level cycle count register. It is used to configure the number of SCL low-level cycles when the I2C module is working.CAUTIONDuring or before system initialization, set I2C_CTRL bit[7] to 0.

Member.name: scl_l
Member.description: Number of SCL low-level cycles. The actual number of SCL low-level cycles is the configured value plus 1 and then multiplied by 2.

RegisterGroup.name: I2C_TXR
RegisterGroup.description: an I2C TX data register. It is used to configure the data to be transmitted.CAUTIONAfter data transmission is complete, the I2C module does not modify I2C_TXR.

Member.name: i2c_txr
Member.description: Data to be transmitted from the master

RegisterGroup.name: I2C_RXR
RegisterGroup.description: an I2C RX data register. It is used to store data received by the master from the slave.CAUTIONData in I2C_RXR is valid when I2C_SR bit[3] is 1. The data is retained until the next read operation starts.

Member.name: i2c_rxr
Member.description: Data received by the master

RegisterGroup.name: LEDKEYINT
RegisterGroup.description: a 2-bit read/write register. It is a keypad sampling interrupt status register.

Member.name: int_press
Member.description:
Key press interrupt flag
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Note: When a key press interrupt is generated, writing 1 to this bit clears the interrupt.

Member.name: int_release
Member.description:
Key release interrupt flag
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Note: When a key release interrupt is generated, writing 1 to this bit clears the interrupt.

RegisterGroup.name: LEDKEYDATA
RegisterGroup.description:
an 8-bit read-only register. It is used to store the LED keypad sampling status.In 8 x 1 scanning mode:
  • For key 0, LedKey0 and CT1642 data signal 0 are valid.
  • For key 1, LedKey0 and CT1642 data signal 1 are valid.
  • For key 2, LedKey0 and CT1642 data signal 2 are valid.
  • For key 3, LedKey0 and CT1642 data signal 3 are valid.
  • For key 4, LedKey0 and CT1642 data signal 4 are valid.
  • For key 5, LedKey0 and CT1642 data signal 5 are valid.
  • For key 6, LedKey0 and CT1642 data signal 6 are valid.
  • For key 7, LedKey0 and CT1642 data signal 7 are valid.

Member.name: status_key7
Member.description:
Status of key 7
0: released
1: pressed

Member.description:
Status of key 6
0: released
1: pressed

Member.description:
Status of key 5
0: released
1: pressed

Member.description:
Status of key 4
0: released
1: pressed

Member.description:
Status of key 3

Member.description:

1: pressed

Member.name: status_key0
Member.description:
Status of key 0
0: released

RegisterGroup.name: LEDCLKTIM
RegisterGroup.description: a 4-bit read/write register. It is used to define the frequency of the LED serial sync clock LedClk.Assume that the system clock is 24 MHz, the value of LEDClkTim is N, the frequency of the LED serial clock LedClk is F, and the LEDSysTim system time frequency divider is Q. The frequency of the LED serial clock LedClk is calculated as follows:F = 24/[(N + 1) x 2 x (Q + 1)] (unit: MHz)

Member.name: led_clk_tim
Member.description: Frequency of the LED serial clock LedClk

RegisterGroup.name: LEDFRETIM
RegisterGroup.description: a 4-bit read/write register. It is used to define the LED refresh frequency and the keypad scanning frequency in 4 x 2 or 8 x 1 scanning mode.Assume that the system clock frequency is 24 MHz, the value of LEDClkTim is N, the value of LEDFreTim is M, the LED refresh frequency is F, the value of LEDSysTim is Q, and the number of LEDs is O, the refresh frequency of the CT1642 LED is calculated as follows:F = 24/[(N + 1) x (Q + 1) x 16 x 40 x (M + 1) x (O + 1)] (unit: MHz)

Member.name: led_fre_tim
Member.description: LED refresh frequency

RegisterGroup.name: LEDFLASHTIM
RegisterGroup.description: an 8-bit read/write register. It is used to define the LED blinking frequency.Assume that the system clock frequency is 24 MHz, the value of LEDClkTim is N, the value of LEDFreTim is M, the value of LEDFlashTim is L, the LED blinking frequency is F, the value of LEDSysTim is Q, and the number of LEDs is O, the blinking frequency of the CT1642 LED is calculated as follows:F = 24/[(N + 1) x (Q + 1) x 16 x 40 x (M + 1) x (O + 1) x (L + 1)] (unit: MHz)

Member.name: led_flash_tim
Member.description: LED blink frequency

RegisterGroup.name: LEDKEYTIM
RegisterGroup.description: a 4-bit read/write register. It is used to define the keypad scanning frequency.Assume that the system clock frequency is 24 MHz, the value of LEDClkTim is N, the value of LEDFreTim is M, the value of LEDKeyTim is P, the keypad scanning frequency is F, the value of LEDSysTim is Q, and the number of LEDs is O, the scanning frequency of the CT1642 keypad is calculated as follows:F = 24/[(N + 1) x (Q + 1) x 16 x 40 x (M + 1) x (O + 1) x 8 x (P + 1)] (unit: MHz)

Member.name: led_key_tim
Member.description: Keypad scanning frequency

Member.name: pcie_slv_device_type
Member.description:
Type of the PCIe (X1) controller
0000: PCIe endpoint device
0001: legacy PCIe endpoint device
0100: root port of PCIe root complex
Other values: reserved

Member.name: pcie_slv_resp_err_map
Member.description:
PCIe0 (X1) controller
The slave device responds to the following errors:
bit[22]: CPL UR
bit[23]: not used
bit[24]: CPL CRS
bit[25]: CPL poisoned
bit[26]: CPL ECRC
bit[27]: CPL abort (MLF or UC)
-UR = unsupported request
-CRS = completion retry request
-UC = unexpected completion
-MLF = malformed

Member.name: pcie_slv_awmisc_info
Member.description:
AXI slave write channel control information of the PCIe (X1) controller
bit[4:0]: AXI transaction's TYPE
bit[5]: AXI transaction's BCM
bit[6]: AXI transaction's EP
bit[7]: AXI transaction's TD
bit[9:8]: AXI transaction's ATTR
bit[12:10]: AXI transaction's TC
bit[20:13]: AXI transaction's MSG code
bit[21]: whether to select the configured transfer type
0: select the type that is calculated by using address mapping
1: select the type configured by using bit[4:0]

Member.name: pcie_int_ctrl
Member.description:
PCIe (X1) controller interrupt mask, active high
The following four bits indicate the interrupt mask signals (0: masked; 1: not masked):
bit[0]: corresponding to cfg_aer_rc_err_int
bit[1]: corresponding to ven_msg_int
bit[2]: corresponding to misc_int
bit[3]: corresponding to cfg_pme_int
When a bit is set to 1, the corresponding interrupt is selected. Only one interrupt is not masked at the same time.
The following four bits indicate whether to report the preceding interrupts over a specific pin:
bit[4]:
1: The preceding interrupts are reported over the inta pin.
0: The preceding interrupts are not reported over the inta pin.
bit[5]:
1: The preceding interrupts are reported over the intb pin.
0: The preceding interrupts are not reported over the intb pin.
bit[6]:
1: The preceding interrupts are reported over the intc pin.
0: The preceding interrupts are not reported over the intc pin.
bit[7]:
1: The preceding interrupts are reported over the intd pin.
0: The preceding interrupts are not reported over the intd pin.
The interrupts can be reported over one of the preceding four pins at the same time.

Member.description:

PME status of PMCSR

Member.name: pcie_hp_msi
Member.description:
PCIe (X1) controller
Hot plug MSI status
0: invalid
1: valid
When the following conditions are met, the signal is valid:
MSI or MSI-X is enabled.
Hot-plug interrupts are enabled in the slot control register.
Any bit in the slot status register transits from 0 to 1 and the associated event notification is enabled in the slot control register.

Member.name: pcie_hp_int
Member.description:
PCIe (X1) controller
Hot plug INTx status
0: invalid
1: valid
When the following conditions are met, the signal is valid:
The INTx assertion disable bit in the command register is 0.
Hot-Plug interrupts are enabled in the slot control register.
Any bit in the slot status register is 1, and the associated event notification is enabled in the slot control register.

Member.name: pcie_hp_pme
Member.description:
PCIe (X1) controller
Hot plug PME status
0: invalid
1: valid
When the following conditions are met, the core can make hp_pme take effect:
The PME enable bit in the power management control and status register is set to 1.
Any bit in the slot status register transits from 0 to 1 and the associated event notification is enabled in the slot control register.

Member.name: pcie_cfg_eml_control
Member.description:
PCIe (X1) controller

1: valid

PCIe slave response composer lookup error, indicating that overflow that occurred in a lookup table of the inbound responses. This indicates that there was a violation for the number of outstanding non-posted requests issued for the outbound direction.
0: invalid
1: valid

Member.name: pcie_gm_cmposer_lookup_err
Member.description:
PCIe (X1) controller
PCIe master response composer lookup error, indicating that an overflow that occurred in a lookup table of the outbound responses. This indicates that there was a violation for the number of outstanding non-posted requests issued for the inbound direction.
0: invalid
1: valid

RegisterGroup.name: PCIE_STAT1
RegisterGroup.description: PCIe status register 1.

Member.name: pcie_cfg_sys_err_rc
Member.description:
PCIe (X1) controller
It indicates that a system error is detected (pulses in a clock cycle).
0: invalid
1: valid

Member.name: pcie_cfg_aer_rc_err_msi
Member.description:
PCIe (X1) controller
Advanced error report MSI status
When the following conditions are met, the core can make the signal take effect within a clock cycle:
MSI or MSI-X is enabled.
A reported error condition causes a bit to be set in the root error status register.
The associated error message reporting enable bit is set in the root error command register.

Member.name: link_req_rst_not_reg
Member.description:
It indicates that the PCIe controller enters the link down status after detecting a link exception and requests for automatic reset.
0: invalid
1: valid

Member.name: bridge_flush_not_reg
Member.description:
Whether the PCIe controller is in the graceful reset status (active low)
0: reset
1: not reset

Member.name: cfg_pme_msi_reg
Member.description:
PME_MSI status
When the following conditions are met, MSI/MSI-X is valid:
The PME enable bit in the root control register is valid.
The PME bit in the root status register is valid.
0: invalid
1: valid

1: valid

Member.name: app_parity_errs_reg
Member.description:
Whether a parity error is detected in the current PCIe controller
bit[6]: whether a parity error is detected in the XTLH channel
bit[5]: whether a parity error is detected in the XADM channel
bit[4]: whether a parity error is detected in the RADM channel

Member.name: axi_parity_errs_reg
Member.description:
Whether a parity error is detected on the AXI bridge address bus of the current PCIe controller
bit[3]: whether a parity error is detected in the client1_addr channel
bit[2]: whether a parity error is detected in the radmx_addr channel
bit[1]: whether a parity error is detected in the slv_req_addr channel
bit[0]: whether a parity error is detected in the mstr_req_addr channel

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_GHC

Member.name: ahci_en
Member.description: Fixed at 1, indicating that software can interact with the controller by using only the AHCI mechanism

Member.name: int_enable
Member.description:
Controller interrupt enable
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: hba_rst
Member.description:
Soft reset control for the controller
0: not reset
1: reset
Writing 1 resets the controller and this bit is cleared after reset; writing 0 has no effect. In addition, reset has no effect on the registers SATA_GHC_BOHC, SATA_PORT_FB, and SATA_PORT_CLB.

Member.name: port_imp
Member.description:
Port validity indication. If the value is 0xF, the four ports, port 0 to port 3, are valid. Bit[3] to bit[0] map to port 3 to port 0 respectively.
0: invalid
1: valid

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_VS
RegisterGroup.description: an AHCI version identifier register.

Member.name: achi_vs
Member.description: AHCI V1.3 is supported.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_CCC_CTL
RegisterGroup.description: a CCC control register.

Member.name: ccc_tv
Member.description:
CCC timeout parameter (in ms)
When the CCC function is enabled, the timeout counter loads this parameter value. If a command is executed on a port involved in CCC counting, the counter decreases by 1 every 1 ms until a CCC interrupt is generated when the counter reaches 0. Then the counter reloads the parameter value for the next counting.
Note that this field cannot be set to 0.

Member.name: ccc_cc
Member.description:
CCC command completion upper threshold
When the CCC function is enabled, the counter is cleared after commands are executed. The counter starts to count the number of completed commands on the ports involved in CCC counting. If the count value is greater than or equal to the parameter value, a CCC interrupt is generated. Then the counter is cleared again for the next counting.
If value 0 is written to this field, the command completion interrupt is disabled, and the CCC interrupt is generated only when a timeout occurs.

Member.name: ccc_int
Member.description: CCC interrupt vector ID. If the value is 0x1F (31), SATA_GHC_IS bit[31] indicates the CCC interrupt status.

Member.name: ccc_en
Member.description:
CCC function enable
0: disabled
1: enabled
When the CCC function is enabled, the values of ccc_tv and ccc_cc cannot be changed.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_CCC_PORTS
RegisterGroup.description: a CCC port enable register.

Member.name: ccc_prt
Member.description:
Ports involved in CCC counting. Bits 3?0 correspond to ports 3?0 respectively. If the related bit is 1, the port is involved in CCC counting. If the related bit is 0, the port is not involved in CCC counting.
The value of this register can be changed at any time and the changed value takes effect immediately.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_CAP2
RegisterGroup.description: feature support register 2.

Member.name: cap_boh
Member.description: Fixed at 1, indicating that BIOS/OS handoff control is supported

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_BOHC
RegisterGroup.description: a BIOS/OS handoff control register.

Member.name: bohc_bb
Member.description:
BIOS status indicator
0: The BIOS is not busy.
1: The BIOS is busy in performing certain operations and is ready to hand the control rights off to the OS.

Member.name: bohc_ooc
Member.description: When the value of bohc_oos is changed from 0 to 1, this bit is fixed at 1. Writing 1 clears this bit and writing 0 has no effect.

Member.name: bohc_sooe
Member.description:
Message interrupt enable
0: No message interrupt is generated.
1: When bohc_ooc is set to 1, a message interrupt is generated.

Member.name: bohc_oos
Member.description:
Request applied by the OS for controlling the controller
0: The OS does not apply for the control permission on the controller.
1: The OS applies for the control permission on the controller. If bohc_oos is 1 and bios_bos is 0, the OS has obtained the control permission on the SATA controller. Resetting the SATA controller by setting SATA_GHC_GHC[hab_rst] has no effect on this bit.

Member.name: bohc_bos
Member.description:
Indicator of the control permission on the controller for the BIOS
0: The BIOS does not have the control permission on the controller.
1: The BIOS has the control permission on the controller. If the OS applies for the permission on the controller, the BIOS clears this bit. Resetting the SATA controller by setting SATA_GHC_GHC[hab_rst] has no effect on this bit.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PHY0_CTLL
RegisterGroup.description: a PHY 0 global control low register.

Member.name: data_sp_by_phy
Member.description:
Data bit extension enable
1: enabled
0: disabled
Note: When speed_sel_mux is 1'b1 and the OOB is generated by the controller, the 20-bit parallel data transmitted by the controller needs to be extended according to the negotiation rate to ensure that the maximum bit rate of a single UI is 1.5 Gbit/s in the OOB phase.

Member.name: oob_send_by_phy
Member.description:
Whether the OOB is generated by the PHY or the controller
1: PHY
0: controller

Member.name: curr_st_cnt
Member.description:
Count value when the state machine current_state at the PHY layer retains 1
Note: If no timeout is detected during the rate negotiation, the status of the state machine at the PHY layer jumps from 8 to 1, and then the state machine immediately generates the comreset OOB because the NANO PHY has special clock frequency switching requirements. If the bit rate is also being switched, the time for a burst in the comreset sequence may be not 320 ns defined in the protocol. In this case, the count value increases by 1.

Member.name: speed_sel_mux
Member.description:
Bit rate switching mode for the NANO PLL
0: general mode. The rate is always 1.5 Gbit/s in the OOB phase, and the rate varies in the data phase.
1: dedicated mode for the NANO PLL. The rate indicator is the same in the OOB phase and the data phase.
This bit takes effect only for the NANO SATA mode.

Member.name: pcs_timeout_cnt
Member.description:
Timeout count control when the bit rate of SATA is being switched. This field is used to ensure that the phy_status signal provided by the NANO can be detected after the bit rate switching is complete.
Note: When speed_sel_mux is 0, this field needs to be set to 0x16 (about 220 ns) because the bit rate of NANO may be switched in different modes.

Member.name: reset
Member.description:
Reset signal, active high. This signal must be retained for 5 ns at least.
Note: This field is valid only for the Synopsys controller.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PHY0_CTLH
RegisterGroup.description: a PHY 0 global control high register.

Member.name: data_invert
Member.description:
0: The endian modes of the PHY and parallel data interface connected to the SATA controller are the same.
1: The endian modes of the PHY and parallel data interface connected to the SATA controller are opposite.

Member.name: test_powerdown

Test control signal for controlling the power-down mode of all circuits. This field is used during the IDDQ test.
0: not powered off
1: powered off
Note: This field is valid only for the Synopsys controller.

Member.name: test_bypass
Member.description:
Test control signal, connected to ground.
Note: This field is valid only for the Synopsys controller.

Member.name: test_burnin
Member.description:
Test control signal, connected to ground.
Note: This field is valid only for the Synopsys controller.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_IS
RegisterGroup.description: a port interrupt status register.

Member.name: pxis_tfes
Member.description:
Task file data (TFD) error interrupt status
0: The ERR bit in SATA_PORT_TFD[tfd_sts] is not 1.
1: The ERR bit in SATA_PORT_TFD[tfd_sts] is 1.

Member.name: pxis_hbds
Member.description:
Internal bus error interrupt
0: The DMAC accesses the memory properly.
1: An error occurs when the DMAC accesses the memory.

Member.name: pxis_ifs
Member.description:
Fatal error interrupt status
0: No error occurs during the data frame transfer.
1: An error occurs during the data frame transfer.

Member.name: pxis_infs
Member.description:
Non-fatal error interrupt status
0: No error occurs during the non-data frame transfer.
1: An error occurs during the non-data frame transfer.

Member.name: pxis_ofs
Member.description:
Data transfer overflow interrupt status
0: No overflow is detected.
1: During the data frame transfer, if the size of the data memory occupied by commands is smaller than the actual data amount, an interrupt is reported at the end of the data transfer.

Member.name: pxis_ipms
Member.description:
PM port number error interrupt status
0: No PM port ID error is detected during data RX.
1: A PM port ID error is detected during data RX.

Member.name: pxis_prcs
Member.description:
PHY state change interrupt status
0: No changes of the phyrdy signals are detected.
1: The changes of the phyrdy signals are detected.
This bit directly reflects the value of SATA_PORT_SERR[diag_n].

Member.name: pxis_pcs
Member.description:
Port connection change interrupt status
0: No COMINIT signal transmitted from the device is detected.
1: A COMINIT signal transmitted from the device is detected.
This bit directly reflects the value of SATA_PORT_SERR[diag.x].

Member.name: pxis_dps
Member.description:
Linked list transfer completion interrupt status
0: The transfer of the linked list data without PRD "I = 1" is complete.
1: The transfer of the linked list data with PRD "I = 1" is complete.

Member.name: pxis_ufs
Member.description:
Unknown FIS interrupt status
0: No unknown FIS is received.
1: An unknown FIS is received.

Member.name: pxis_sdbs
Member.description:
Set device bits FIS interrupt status
0: no effect
1: A set device bits FIS is received and the I bit is 1.

Member.name: pxis_dss
Member.description:
DMA setup FIS interrupt status
0: This bit is meaningless.
1: A DMA setup FIS is received and the I bit is 1.

Member.name: pxis_pss
Member.description:
PIO setup FIS interrupt status
0: This bit is meaningless.
1: A PIO setup FIS is received and the I bit is 1.

Member.name: pxis_dhrs
Member.description:
D2H register FIS interrupt status
0: This bit is meaningless.
1: A D2H register FIS is received and the I bit is 1.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_CMD
RegisterGroup.description: a port command and status register.

Member.name: cmd_icc
Member.description:
Port communications control signal
0x0: no operation. It indicates that the next port state request is allowed.
0x1: request for enabling the port to enter the active state
0x2: request for enabling the port to enter the partial state
0x6: request for enabling the port to enter in the slumber state
Other values: reserved
When software writes any of the preceding values rather than the reserved values, the controller clears the cmd_icc bit after performing related operations. When software requests the current state of the port, the controller clears the cmd_icc bit directly. If software requests the port state change from a low-power state to another lower-power state, for example, from the partial state to the slumber state, it needs to request the state change from the partial state to the active state, and then to the slumber state.

Member.name: cmd_asp
Member.description:
Slumber or partial state select for power management
0: If ALPes is set to 1, the HBA enters the partial state.
1: If ALPes is set to 1, the HBA enters the slumber state.

Member.name: cmd_alpe
Member.description:
Automatic power management enable
0: disabled
1: enabled
If SATA_PORT_CI and SATA_PORT_SACT are cleared, the controller enters the power-management state automatically. To be specific, if cmd_asp is 1, the controller enters the slumber state; if cmd_asp is 0, the controller enters the partial state.

Member.name: cmd_dlae
Member.description:
LED drive enable in ATAPI mode
0: The LED pin can be driven when cmd_atapi is 0 and commands are being executed.
1: The LED pin can be driven when commands are being executed.

Member.name: cmd_atapi
Member.description:
ATAPI device indicator
0: The current device is not an ATAPI device.
1: The current device is an ATAPI device.

Member.name: fbscp
Member.description:
Whether the port supports FIS-based switching. When SATA_GHC_CAP1[spm] and SATA_GHC_CAP1[FBSS] are set to 1, this bit must be set to 1.
0: not supported
1: supported

Member.name: cmd_esp
Member.description: Fixed at 1, indicating that the eSATA device is supported

Member.name: cmd_pma
Member.description:
PM detection indicator
0: No PM connects to the port.
1: A PM connects to the port.

Member.name: cmd_cr
Member.description:
Command list processing indicator.
0: No command is being executed.
1: A command is being executed.

Member.name: cmd_fr
Member.description:
FIS RX processing indication
0: No FIS can be received.
1: FISs can be received.

Member.name: cmd_ccs
Member.description:
Slot number of the current command
This field is valid when cmd_st is 1 and is cleared when cmd_st is 0.

Member.name: cmd_fre
Member.description:
FIS RX enable control
0: The received FISs cannot be written to the system memory.
1: FISs can be received and written to the system memory.
Software needs to set the RX FIS base address register SATA_PORT_FB before enabling this bit to receive FISs. When cmd_st is 1, this bit must be set to 1.

Member.name: cmd_clo
Member.description:
BSY/DQR clear control. Software can forcibly clear the BSY and DRQ bits by configuring the cmd_clo bit and transmit commands to the device.
0: no effect
1: The BSY and DRQ bits in SATA_PORT_TFD[tfd_sts] are cleared. After the BSY and DRQ bits are 0, the cmd_clo bit is automatically cleared.
The cmd_clo bit can be set to 1 only before the value of cmd_st is changed from 0 to 1. Software must write 1 to cmd_st after the cmd_clo bit is cleared.

Member.name: cmd_sud
Member.description:
Spin-up device control
0: When SATA_PORT_SCTL[det] is 0, the controller enters the listen mode.
1: After the system is powered on or the HBA is reset, the controller is enabled to transmit a COMRESET sequence to initialize the hard disk.

Member.name: cmd_st
Member.description:
Command list processing enable
0: The controller becomes idle.
1: The controller processes the commands for all slots that are identified as valid by SATA_PORT_CI from slot 0.
Note: The cmd_st bit can be set to 1 only after cmd_fre is 1.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_TFD
RegisterGroup.description: a port task file register.

Member.name: tfd_err
Member.description:
Task file error register value
The controller updates this field after receiving a D2H register FIS, a PIO setup FIS, or an SDB FIS.

Member.name: tfd_sts
Member.description:
Task file status
bit[7]: BSY bit. The device is busy.
bit[6:4]: The meaning of these bits varies according to commands.
bit[3]: DRQ bit. There is data to be transferred in the device.
bit[2:1]: The meaning of these bits varies according to commands.
bit[0]: ERR bit. An error occurs during the data transfer.
The controller updates this field after receiving a D2H register FIS, a PIO setup FIS, or an SDB FIS.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SIG
RegisterGroup.description: a port signature register.

Member.name: signature
Member.description:
LBA address and sector addressing. The allocated addresses are as follows:
bit[31:24]: LBA upper-bit address
bit[23:16]: LBA middle-bit address
bit[15:8]: LBA lower-bit address
bit[7:0]: number of sectors
The controller updates this register when receiving the first D2H register FIS after the hard disk is reset.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SSTS
RegisterGroup.description: a port status register.

Member.name: pxssts_ipm
Member.description:
Current port status
0x0: There is no device or no communication is set up.
0x1: active
0x2: partial
0x6: slumber
Other values: reserved

Member.name: pxssts_spd
Member.description:
Port negotiation speed status
0x0: There is no device or no communication is set up.
0x1: Rate 1 is selected during negotiation for communication.
0x2: Rate 2 is selected during negotiation for communication.
0x3: Rate 3 is selected during negotiation for communication.
Other values: reserved

Member.name: pxssts_det
Member.description:
Device detection and PHY status
0x0: No device is detected and no PHY communication is set up.
0x1: A device is detected but no PHY communication is set up.
0x3: A device is detected and the PHY communication is set up.
0x4: The PHY is offline or in the built in self test (BIST) state.
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SCTL
RegisterGroup.description: a port control register.

Member.name: pxsctl_ipm
Member.description:
Port power management status control
0x0: There is no special requirement.
0x1: The port is not allowed to enter the partial state.
0x2: The port is not allowed to enter the slumber state.
0x3: The port is not allowed to enter the partial or slumber state.
Other values: reserved

Member.name: pxsctl_spd
Member.description:
Port communications speed control
0x0: There is no special requirement.
0x1: The communication rate is limited to rate 1.
0x2: The communication rate is limited to rate 2.
0x3: The communication rate is limited to rate 3.
Other values: reserved

Member.name: pxsctl_det
Member.description:
Device detection and port initialization control
0x0: There is no device detection or initialization request.
0x1: The port is requested to reset the initialization sequence COMRESET.
0x4: The port is forced to enter the offline state.
Other values: reserved
When pxsctl_det is set to 1, the controller transmits the COMRESET sequence to the device. In this case, software must retain the value of pxsctl_det for at least 1 ms, ensuring that the device receives the COMRESET sequence.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SERR
RegisterGroup.description: an error diagnosis status register.

Member.name: diag_x
Member.description:
Device detection status
0: No COMINIT signal transmitted from the device is detected.
1: A COMINIT signal transmitted from the device is detected.

Member.name: diag_f
Member.description:
Detection status of the unknown FIS
0: No unknown FIS is received.
1: An unknown FIS is received and the cyclic redundancy check (CRC) is correct.

Member.name: diag_s
Member.description:
Link layer error status
0: No state transition error occurs at the link layer.
1: A state transition error occurs at the link layer.

Member.name: diag_h
Member.description:
Handshake error status
0: No R_ERR primitive transmitted from the device is received.
1: One or more R_ERR primitives transmitted from the device are received.

Member.name: diag_c
Member.description:
CRC error status
0: No CRC error occurs during FIS reception.
1: A CRC error occurs during FIS reception.

Member.name: diag_b
Member.description:
Decoding error status
0: No 8B/10B decoding error is detected.
1: An 8B/10B decoding error is detected.

Member.name: diag_w
Member.description:
COMWAKE status
0: No COMWAKE signal transmitted from the device is detected.
1: A COMWAKE signal transmitted from the device is detected.

Member.name: diag_i
Member.description:
PHY internal error status
0: No PHY internal error is detected.
1: A PHY internal error is detected.

Member.name: diag_n
Member.description:
PhyRdy signal change status
0: The PhyRdy signal is not changed.
1: The PhyRdy signal is changed.
This bit is set to 1 when the value of the PhyRdy signal is changed from 1 to 0 or from 0 to 1.

Member.name: err_p
Member.description:
SATA protocol non-compliance error status
0: The device behavior complies with the SATA protocol.
1: Certain device behavior does not comply with the SATA protocol.

Member.name: err_t
Member.description:
Data integrity error status
0: No data integrity error is detected.
1: A data integrity error is detected.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SACT
RegisterGroup.description: an NCQ command identifier control register.

Member.name: port_sact
Member.description:
NCQ command identifier control
Each bit of this register corresponds to a tag ID and an NCQ command in the memory. To be specific, bit[31:0] correspond to the commands of slots 31–0 and tags 31–0 respectively. The following describes the meaning of each bit by taking bit 3 as an example:
0: The slot 3 command is a non-NCQ command.
1: The slot 3 command is an NCQ command. Before setting SATA_PORT_CI bit[3] to 1, software must set SATA_PORT_SACT bit[3] to 1. After the command data transfer, the device transmits an SDB FIS. Then the controller clears SATA_PORT_SACT bit[3] based on the SActive in the FIS.
Software can set SATA_PORT_SACT only when cmd_st is 1. When cmd_st is 0, all bits of SATA_PORT_SACT are cleared.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_CI
RegisterGroup.description: a command TX control register.

Member.name: port_ci
Member.description:
Control for the commands to be transmitted
Each bit of this register corresponds to a command in the memory. To be specific, bit[31:0] correspond to the commands of slots 31–0 respectively. The following describes the meaning of each bit by taking bit 3 as an example:
0: There is no command to be transmitted and executed in slot 3.
1: A slot 3 command is created in the memory. Then the controller can transmit this command. After running this command and receiving a corresponding FIS, the controller clears SATA_PORT_CI bit[3] and the BSY, DRQ, and ERR bits in SATA_PORT_TFD.
The bits in SATA_PORT_CI can be set to 1 only when cmd_st is 1, and all bits in SATA_PORT_CI are cleared when cmd_st is 0.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SNTF
RegisterGroup.description: an async notification event indicator register.

Member.name: pxsntf_pmn
Member.description:
Async notification event status
If the controller receives an SDB FIS from the device on the PM port and the N bit in this FIS is 1, the controller sets the bit of this register corresponding to this port ID to 1.
The following describes the meaning of each bit by taking bit 3 as an example:
0: No async notification event occurs on the device whose PM port number is 3.
1: An async notification event occurs on the device whose PM port ID is 3.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_FBS
RegisterGroup.description: an FBS control register.

Member.name: fbs_dwe
Member.description: A fatal error occurs on the device corresponding to the current PM port. This field is configured by hardware and is valid only when PxFBS.SDE is 1.

Member.name: fbs_ado
Member.description: Maximum number of external devices mounted over the PM during the current FIS-based switching. This field is configured by hardware. The number of PM domains corresponding to the created command should be less than the value when a command is created for optimal performance.

Member.name: fbs_dev
Member.description: ID of the PM port to which the next command is transmitted. This field is configured by software. Software cannot transmit commands to multiple PM ports. Therefore, when a CI is created, commands cannot be transmitted to multiple PM ports. The same PM port must be used for a CI.

Member.name: fbs_sde
Member.description: When this field is set to 1, a fatal error occurs, and hardware considers that software processes this error first. This field is cleared by setting PxCMD.ST to 0. When PxFBS.DEC is set to 1 or PxCMD.ST is set to 0, the fbs_sde bit needs to be cleared.

Member.name: fbs_dec
Member.description: When software sets this bit to 1, the HBA needs to clear the error trigger conditions and clear the commands of the outstanding corresponding to the device including PxCI and PxSACT of the device. After hardware rectifies the error, the hardware must set this bit to 0. Writing 0 to this bit by using software has no effect. Software can set this bit to 1 only when PxFBS.EN and PxFBS.SDE are 1.

Member.name: fbs_en
Member.description: When this bit is set to 1, a PM is connected, and the HBA needs to enable FIB-based switching to communicate with the PM. When this bit is cleared, FIS-based switching is unavailable. Software can modify this bit only when PxCMD.ST is 0.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_FIFOTH
RegisterGroup.description: an RX FIFO threshold register.

Member.name: sync_bug_en
Member.description: The xrdy_sync_xrdy primitive sequence appears during the detection of the PM card. After that, no matter what primitives the PM transmits, the host returns only SYNC, and the host link layer state machine is suspended. The version can be rolled back to the earlier version when this bit is 0.

Member.name: overflow_bug_en
Member.description: When overflow occurs, the DMAC layer state machine is suspended. Modifications are made in this version to resolve this issue. The version can be rolled back to the earlier version when this bit is 0.

Member.name: ncq_fbs_bug_en
Member.description: When a port of the controller connects to the PM and the FBS is enabled, if multiple hard disks are mounted over the PM and the DMA command is executed, command timeout occurs. Modifications are made in this version to resolve this issue. The version can be rolled back to the earlier version when this bit is 0.

Member.name: cfg_contp_en
Member.description:
Whether to enable the contp logic (for resolving the EMI issue when the same primitive is transmitted in idle state)
1: enabled. The contp primitive is transmitted in idle state to reduce the EMI.
0: disabled. The contp primitive is not transmitted in idle state.

Member.name: cfg_px_cmd_st
Member.description:
px_cmd_st retain enable
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: sdb_bug_en_2
Member.description:
SDB bug enable signal 2
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: atapi_bug_en_2
Member.description:
ATAPI bug enable signal 2
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: atapi_bug_en
Member.description:
ATAPI bug enable signal
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: sdb_bug_en
Member.description:
SDB bug enable signal
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: mem_ctrl
Member.description:
Timing parameter for controlling the memory
bit[13:11]: EMAA in the corresponding memory
bit[14]: EMSA in the corresponding memory
bit[17:15]: EMAB in the corresponding memory

Member.name: rflush_bug_en
Member.description:
TX FIFO flush bug enable
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: hold_seagate_bug_en
Member.description: The test shows that some Seagate hard disks do not comply with the protocol. To be specific, CONTp is transmitted after primitives are transmitted once. This bug can be avoided by setting this bit to 1.

Member.name: dmac_rxfifo_th
Member.description: Flow control threshold for the DMAC RX FIFO. During data reception, if the data amount in the DMAC FIFO is above the threshold, the controller starts to control the data flow.

Member.name: rxfifo_th_sel
Member.description:
Flow control FIFO select.
0: The flow control for the link RX FIFO is valid.
1: The flow control for the DMAC RX FIFO is valid.

Member.name: link_rxfifo_th
Member.description: Flow control threshold for the link RX FIFO. During data reception, if the data amount in the DMAC FIFO is above the threshold, the controller starts to control the data flow.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_PHYCTL1
RegisterGroup.description: PHY control register 1.

Member.name: px_tx_invert
Member.description:
Whether polarity reverse is allowed in the TX direction
0: not allowed
1: allowed

Member.name: px_nearafelb
Member.description: Loopback mode for the BIST test

Member.name: px_bpr_reset
Member.description: Reset in BIST mode

Member.name: px_rx_eq
Member.description: Equalization setting in the RX direction

Member.name: px_tx_amplitude_gen3
Member.description:
Amplitude of the TX signal in Gen3 mode
The default value is 7'b1011100.

Member.name: px_tx_amplitude_gen2
Member.description:
Amplitude of the TX signal in Gen2 mode
The default value is 7'b1011100.

Member.name: nano_tx_eye_ctrl
Member.description:
NANO PHY TX end signal quality control
bit[6:4]: TX signal amplitude control signal tx_margin
bit[3:2]: TX signal preemphasis control signal tx_deemph
bit[1]: TX signal amplitude type control signal tx_swing
The default value is 7'b1011100.

Member.name: px_rx_invert
Member.description:
Whether polarity reverse is allowed in the RX direction
0: not allowed
1: allowed

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_PHYCTL2
RegisterGroup.description: PHY control register 2.

Member.name: px_reset
Member.description: Lane reset signal of the SerDes, async reset, active high

Member.name: px_comreset_en
Member.description:
Whether to transmit comreset OOB immediately after the status of the state machine at the PHY layer changes from PHY_wait to PHY_comreset, or to transmit comreset OOB after the PHY clock becomes stable. The NANO PHY clock switching is slow, and comreset OOB needs to be transmitted a period after the clock switching; otherwise, the transmitted comreset OOB may be incorrect.
1: Transmit comreset OOB immediately.
0: Transmit comreset OOB after the PHY clock becomes stable.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_DATA
RegisterGroup.description: an SCI data register. It is used to transmit or receive characters and serves as the data interface between the SCI and software.The software can write to this register only after SCI_CR1[mode] is set to 1. If SCI_CR1[mode] is set to 0, writing to this register has no effect.

Member.name: parity
Member.description:
Parity check error flag
This bit is transmitted with data during data transmission. During data reception, software checks whether parity check is correct based on the value of this bit.
0: correct
1: incorrect

Member.name: scidata
Member.description: 8-bit data to be read or written

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CR0
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI control register 0. It is used to control the information such as clock enable, parity check, transfer handshake, and transfer bit definition.CAUTIONSCI_CR0[paritybit] determines whether to enable the parity check function during data transmission or reception. When this bit is set to 0, the received or transmitted frame does not contain the parity bit. According to the T0 or T1 protocol, this bit must be set to 1.
  • SCI_CR0[clkdis] and SCI_CR0[clkval] determine whether to enable the smart card clock and configure the state of the clock pin after the clock is disabled.
  • SCI_CR0[rxnak] and SCI_CR0[txnak] determine whether to enable the handshake mechanisms between the SCI and the smart card. A handshake is implemented when the RX end pulls down the data line (I/O) to request the TX end to retransmit characters after detecting a parity check error in the data sent from the TX end. The handshake mechanisms for data transmission and reception are separately enabled. The maximum retry count during data transmission or reception is defined by SCI_RETRY. During ATR reception, character retransmission is not allowed; therefore, the handshake mechanism must be disabled by setting the corresponding TX or RX control bit to 0. SCI_CR0[rxparity] and SCI_CR0[txparity] control the parity check mode during data reception and transmission respectively.According to the direct convention, the low level of the data line (I/O) indicates logic 0 and the LSB of data is after the start bit of a frame. If SCI_CR0 bit[1:0] are set to 0b00, the direct convention is selected.According to the inverse convention, the low level of the data line (I/O) indicates logic 1 and the MSB of data is after the start bit of a frame. If SCI_CR0 bit[1:0] are set to 0b11, the inverse convention is selected.
NOTE
  • The character bit sequence and inversion of the data and parity bits can be separately configured. These features enable the SCI to support non-standard protocols (non-direct convention or non-inverse convention).
  • Before the start TS character of the ATR is received, SCI_CR0 bit[1:0] must be set to 0b00.

Member.name: detect_inv
Member.description:
Valid level for the detected input signal
0: active high
1: active low

Member.name: vccen_inv
Member.description:
Valid level for the vccen output signal
0: active high
1: active low

Member.name: paritybit
Member.description:
Parity bit transfer enable
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: clkval
Member.description:
Status of the smart card clock when the clock stops
0: The smart card clock retains low level.
1: The smart card clock retains high level.

Member.name: clkdis
Member.description:
Clock start/stop control
0: The clock starts.
1: The clock stops.

Member.name: rxnak
Member.description:
Behavior control in RX mode
0: The SCI does not pull down the I/O line when detecting a parity error.
1: The SCI pulls down the I/O line when detecting a parity error.

Member.name: rxparity
Member.description:
Parity check mode control in RX mode
0: even parity check
1: odd parity check

Member.name: txnak
Member.description:
Behavior control in TX mode
0: The SCI does not detect whether the receiver pulls down the I/O line.
1: The SCI detects whether the receiver pulls down the I/O line.

Member.name: txparity
Member.description:
Parity check mode control in TX mode
0: even parity check
1: odd parity check

Member.name: order
Member.description:
Character bit sequence
0: The LSB is transmitted or received after the start bit.
1: The MSB is transmitted or received after the start bit.

Member.name: sense
Member.description:
Whether to detect the data and parity bits on the I/O line after inversion
0: The SCI directly detects data and parity bits on the I/O line.
1: The SCI detects data and parity bits on the I/O line after inversion.

Member.name: synccard

Operation mode of the smart card

1: sync mode

Debounce wait counter select after the card is inserted and stable. For details, see the description of SCI_STABLE.
0: The entire internal debounce counter is used.
1: The non-programmable part of the internal counter is bypassed.

Member.name: bgten
Member.description:
Block guard counter enable for the block guard mechanism
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: clkz1
Member.description:
SCI_CLK pin output configuration
0: CMOS output
1: OD output

Member.name: mode
Member.description:
TX/RX mode
0: RX mode
1: TX mode

Member.name: blken
Member.description:
Block timeout count mechanism enable
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: atrden
Member.description:
ATR timeout count mechanism enable
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CR2
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI control register 2. After a value is written to a specific bit of SCI_CR2, the SCI activates, releases, or soft-resets the smart card. When the SCI is releasing the smart card, write operations on this register are ignored. In other cases, writing 1 to SCI_CR2[finish] enables the SCI to immediately send a card release timing.CAUTION
  • The software writes to SCI_CR2 only in appropriate card operation phases. An inappropriate write may result in an unexpected result.
  • The smart card can be soft-reset by software only after the card is activated.

Member.name: wreset
Member.description:
Soft reset on the smart card
0: invalid
1: soft-reset
Note: This bit can be written only after the activation timing is transmitted. Otherwise, writing to this bit has no effect.

Member.name: finish
Member.description:
Release operation on the smart card
0: invalid
1: released
Note: This bit can be written only after the card reader detects a smart card. Otherwise, writing to this bit has no effect.

Member.name: startup
Member.description:
Activation operation on the smart card
0: invalid
1: activated
Note: This bit can be written only after the card reader detects a smart card. Otherwise, writing to this bit has no effect.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CLKICC
RegisterGroup.description: a smart card clock frequency register. It defines the clock divider of the external smart card. The frequency of the smart card clock is calculated as follows: FSCI_CLK = FREFCLK/[2 x (clkicc + 1)]. FSCI_CLK indicates the clock frequency, FREFCLK indicates the frequency of the reference clock, and clkicc is the value configured in SCI_CLKICC[clkicc].

Member.name: clkicc
Member.description: Divider of the smart card clock (obtained by dividing the reference clock frequency). Its value range is 0?255.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_VALUE
RegisterGroup.description: an SCI_BAUD cycle count register in an ETU. Its value range is 5?255 and is used to calculate the ETU as follows: ETU = (1 + baud) x value/FREFCLK. FREFCLK is the frequency of the reference clock, baud is the value configured in SCI_BAUD[baud], and value is the value configured in SCI_VALUE[value].

Member.name: value
Member.description: Number of SCI_BAUD cycles in an ETU

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_BAUD
RegisterGroup.description: a baud rate clock divider register. It is used to calculate the ETU and its value range is 0x1?0xFFFF. For details about how to calculate the ETU, see the description of SCI_VALUE.

Member.name: baud
Member.description: Clock divider of the baud rate

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_TIDE
RegisterGroup.description:
a TX/RX FIFO overflow threshold register.NOTE
The characters in the TX FIFO are removed only after data is successfully transmitted.

Member.name: rxtide
Member.description:
Value for triggering the SCI RX TIDEINTR interrupt
When the number of characters in the RX FIFO is greater than or equal to SCI_TIDE[rxtide], the RX FIFO overflow interrupt is triggered.

Member.name: txtide
Member.description:
Value for triggering the SCI TXTIDEINTR interrupt
When the number of characters in the TX FIFO is less than or equal to SCI_TIDE[txtide], the TX FIFO overflow interrupt is triggered.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_STABLE
RegisterGroup.description:
a smart card insertion stable time register. After the SCI detects that the SCI_DETECT signal is valid, the signal must retain valid for the period (in second) specified by TSTABLE that corresponds to the value defined in the SCI_STABLE register. After the period specified by TSTABLE has elapsed, an interrupt is triggered, indicating that the smart card has been properly inserted. The value of TSTABLE varies according to counter:
  • When the entire internal debounce counter is selected (that is, SCI_CR1[exdbnce] is set to 0), TSTABLE is calculated as follows: TSTABLE = (1 + Stable) x 65535 x TREFCLK. TREFCLK indicates the SCI reference clock cycle (1/48 MHz), and stable is the value configured in SCI_STABLE[stable].
  • When the non-programmable part of the internal debounce counter is bypassed (that is, SCI_CR1[exdbnce] is set to 1), TSTABLE is calculated as follows: TSTABLE = Stable x TREFCLK.

Member.name: stable
Member.description: Duration during which the card detection signal is held high

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_ATIME
RegisterGroup.description:
a smart card activation time register.NOTE
SCI_ATIME[atime] must be at least 40,000 smart card clock (SCI_CLK) cycles to ensure card reset. SCI_ATIME[atime] must also ensure power stability for the smart card.

Member.name: atime
Member.description: Duration (SCI_CLK cycle count) of each of the three phases involved in the card activation timing

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_DTIME
RegisterGroup.description: a smart card release time register.

Member.name: dtime
Member.description: Duration (SCI reference clock cycle) of each of the three phases involved in the card release timing

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_ATRSTIME
RegisterGroup.description: an ATR RX start time threshold register. Based on the smart card clock, the register defines the time threshold from finishing smart card reset to starting to receive the first ATR character. If waiting for the ATR RX start signal times out, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[atrstoutim] is set to 1.SCI_ATRSTIME[atrstime] must be set to 40,000 SCI_CLK cycles by software.

Member.name: atrstime
Member.description: Timeout threshold (SCI_CLK cycle) for starting ATR reception

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_ATRDTIME
RegisterGroup.description:
an ATR RX time threshold register. If the duration from receiving the first ATR character to receiving the last one exceeds the duration (in ETU) defined in this register, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[atrdtoutris] is set to 1.NOTE
  • Before using this register, set SCI_CR1[atrden] to 1 to enable the timeout count mechanism.
  • According to the protocol, it is recommended that this register be set to 19,200 ETUs (0x4B00).

Member.name: atrdtime
Member.description: ATR RX timeout threshold (in ETU), counting from the start bit of the first ATR character

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_STOPTIME
RegisterGroup.description: a clock stop time register. When the smart card clock stops, it becomes invalid after the time defined in SCI_STOPTIME (SCI_CLK cycles) has elapsed. Then an interrupt is triggered, and SCI_RIS[clkstpris] is set to 1.According to the protocol, the minimum clock stop time is 1860 SCI_CLK cycles, that is, when SCI_STOPTIME[stoptime] is set to 0x744.

Member.name: stoptime
Member.description: Time (SCI_CLK cycles) for stopping the smart card clock

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_STARTTIME
RegisterGroup.description: a smart card clock recovery time register. If clock recovery is enabled, data can be transferred between the smart card and the SCI after the time (SCI_CLK cycles) defined in SCI_STARTTIME has elapsed. Then, an interrupt is triggered, and SCI_RIS[clkactris] is set to 1.According to the protocol, the minimum clock recovery time is 700 SCI_CLK cycles, that is, when SCI_STARTTIME[starttimr] is set to 0x2BC.

Member.name: starttime
Member.description: Duration (SCI_CLK cycles) from starting the card clock to activating data transfer between the SCI and the smart card

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_RETRY
RegisterGroup.description:
an RX/TX retry times register. It defines the allowed number of TX or RX retry times. The details are as follows:
  • If SCI_CR0[txnak] is enabled, the SCI checks whether the RX end identifies a parity error. SCI_RETRY[rxretry] defines the maximum number of retry times after a parity error occurs. If the maximum number of retry times is exceeded, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[txerrris] is set to 1.
  • If SCI_CR0[rxnak] is enabled, the SCI checks whether a parity error occurs in the received data. SCI_RETRY[txretry] defines the maximum number of retry times allowed after a parity error occurs. If the number is exceeded but the RX error still persists, SCI_DATA[parity] is set to 1.

Member.name: rxretry
Member.description: Maximum number of RX retry times after a parity error occurs during reception

Member.name: txretry
Member.description: Maximum number of TX retry times after a parity error occurs during transmission

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CHTIMELS
RegisterGroup.description:
a character RX interval timeout threshold lower 16-bit register.CAUTION
  • The SCI_CHTIME register consists of the lower 16-bit SCI_CHTIMELS register and the upper 16-bit SCI_CHTIMEMS register. SCI_CHTIME does not immediately take effect after software writes to SCI_CHTIMEMS. It takes effect only after software writes to SCI_CHTIMELS. Therefore, you need to configure the upper 16 bits and then the lower 16 bits of SCI_CHTIME in sequence.
  • SCI_CHTIMELS is a character RX interval timeout threshold lower 16-bit register.
  • SCI_CHTIME defines the maximum time interval (in ETU) between the start edges of two consecutive characters received from the smart card. If the character RX interval times out, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[chtoutris] is set to 1.

Member.name: chtimels
Member.description: Lower 16 bits of the character RX interval timeout threshold register SCICHTIME

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CHTIMEMS
RegisterGroup.description: a character RX interval timeout threshold upper 16-bit register.

Member.name: chtimems
Member.description: Upper 16 bits of the character RX interval timeout threshold register SCICHTIME

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_BLKTIMELS
RegisterGroup.description:
a block RX interval timeout threshold lower 16-bit register.CAUTION
  • The SCI_BLKTIME register consists of the lower 16-bit SCI_BLKTIMELS register and the upper 16-bit SCI_BLKTIMEMS register. SCI_BLKTIME does not immediately take effect after software writes to SCI_BLKTIMEMS. It takes effect only after software writes to SCI_BLKTIMELS. Therefore, you need to configure the upper 16 bits and then the lower 16 bits of SCI_BLKTIME in sequence.
  • SCI_BLKTIMELS is a block RX interval timeout threshold lower 16-bit register.
  • SCI_BLKTIME defines the maximum block RX interval (in ETU). The interval is counted from the start edge of the last character that is transmitted to the smart card to the time when the first character returned from the smart card is received.
  • If the interval times out, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[blkoutim] is set to 1.

Member.name: blktimels
Member.description: Lower 16 bits of the block RX interval timeout threshold register SCIBLKTIME

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_BLKTIMEMS
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_BLKTIMES is a block RX interval timeout threshold upper 16-bit register.

Member.name: blktimems
Member.description: Upper 16 bits of the block RX interval timeout threshold register SCIBLKTIME

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CHGUARD
RegisterGroup.description: a character guard interval register. It defines the minimum extra guard interval (in ETU) between the start edges of two consecutive characters when the SCI is transmitting characters to the smart card. The character guard interval depends on the global interface byte TC1 (obtained from the ATR timing) defined in the protocol.

Member.name: scichguard
Member.description: Character guard interval (in ETU)

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_BLKGUARD
RegisterGroup.description: a block guard interval register. When the transfer directions of two consecutive characters are opposite, the interval between their start edges is the value defined in SCI_BLKGUARD.

Member.name: sciblkguard
Member.description: Minimum interval (unit: ETU) between two consecutive characters with opposite transfer directions

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_RXTIME
RegisterGroup.description: an RX FIFO read timeout threshold register. When there are characters in the RX FIFO and the characters are not read within the period defined in SCI_RXTIME, the RX read timeout interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[rtoutris] is set to 1.CAUTIONNever set SCI_RXTIME[rxtime] to 0x0000 when you use the read timeout interrupt function of the RX FIFO.

Member.name: rxtime
Member.description: RX read timeout threshold (unit: SCI_CLK cycle)

Member.name: rxfe
Member.description:

1: empty

Member.description:

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_TXCOUNT
RegisterGroup.description: a TX FIFO data count register.CAUTIONIf an error defined in the T0 protocol occurs when characters are transmitted to the smart card, and the number of retransmission times exceeds the allowed value defined in SCI_RETRY, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[txerrris] is set to 1. Before the next transmission, the TX FIFO must be cleared by writing to SCI_TXCOUNT.

Member.name: txcount
Member.description: Reading this register returns the number of characters in the TX FIFO. Writing any value to this register clears the TX FIFO.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_RXCOUNT
RegisterGroup.description: an RX FIFO data count register.

Member.name: rxcount
Member.description: Reading this register returns the number of characters in the RX FIFO. Writing any value to this register clears the RX FIFO.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_DR
RegisterGroup.description: a UART data register that stores the received data and data to be transmitted. The RX status can be queried by reading this register.

Member.name: oe
Member.description:
Overflow error
0: No overflow error occurs.
1: An overflow error occurs. That is, a data segment is received when the RX FIFO is full.

Member.name: be
Member.description:
Break error
0: No break error occurs.
1: A break error occurs. That is, the RX data input signal retains low longer than a full word transfer. A full word consists of a start bit, data bits, a parity bit, and a stop bit.

Member.name: pe
Member.description:
Parity error
0: No parity error occurs.
1: A parity error occurs.

Member.name: fe
Member.description:
Frame error
0: No frame error occurs.
1: A frame error (namely, stop bit error) occurs.

Member.name: data
Member.description: Data to be transmitted and received

RegisterGroup.name: UART_RSR
RegisterGroup.description:
an RX status register or error clear register.
  • It acts as the RX status register when being read.
  • It acts as the error clear register when being written.You can obtain the RX status by reading UART_DR. The break, frame, and parity status information read from UART_DR takes priority over that read from UART_RSR. That is, the status information in UART_DR updates faster than that in UART_RSR.
CAUTIONWriting any value to UART_RSR resets it.

Member.name: oe
Member.description:
Overflow error
0: No overflow error occurs.
1: An overflow error occurs.
When the FIFO is full, the contents in the FIFO remain valid. No data will be written to the FIFO and the shift register overflows. In this case, the CPU must read data immediately to spare the FIFO.

Member.name: be
Member.description:
Break error
0: No break error occurs.
1: A break error occurs.
If the RX data input signal remains low longer than a full word transfer, a break error is considered. A full word consists of a start bit, data bits, a parity bit, and a stop bit.

Member.name: pe
Member.description:
Parity error
0: No parity error occurs.
1: A parity error occurs in the received data.
In FIFO mode, the error is associated with the data at the top of the FIFO.

Member.name: fe
Member.description:
Frame error
0: No frame error occurs.
1: An error occurs in the stop bit of the received data. The valid stop bit is 1.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_FR
RegisterGroup.description: a UART flag register.

Member.name: txfe
Member.description:
This bit is defined by the status of UART_LCR_H[fen].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the TX holding register is empty. If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the TX FIFO is empty.

Member.name: rxff
Member.description:
This bit is defined by the status of UART_LCR_H[fen].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the RX holding register is full. If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the RX FIFO is full.

Member.name: txff
Member.description:
This bit is defined by the status of UART_LCR_H[fen].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the TX holding register is full. If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the TX FIFO is full.

Member.name: rxfe
Member.description:
This bit is defined by the status of UART_LCR_H[fen].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the RX holding register is empty. If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the RX FIFO is empty.

Member.name: busy
Member.description:
UART busy/idle status
0: The UART is idle or data transmission is complete.
1: The UART is busy transmitting data.
If this bit is set to 1, the status is retained until the entire byte (including all stop bits) is transmitted from the shift register.
No matter whether the UART is enabled, this bit is set to 1 when the TX FIFO is not empty.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_IBRD
RegisterGroup.description: an integral baud rate register.

Member.name: bauddivint
Member.description: Clock divider corresponding to the integral part of the baud rate. All bits are cleared during reset.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_FBRD
RegisterGroup.description:
a decimal baud rate register.CAUTION
  • The values of UART_IBRD and UART_FBRD are updated only after the current data transmission or reception is complete.
  • The minimum clock divider is 1, and the maximum clock divider is 65,535 (216 ? 1). That is, UART_IBRD cannot be 0, and UART_FBRD is ignored if UART_IBRD is 0. If UART_FBRD is 65535 (0xFFFF), UARTFBRD cannot be greater than 0; otherwise, RX and TX failures occur. If UART_FBRD is set to 0x1E and UART_IBRD is set to 0x01, the integral part of the clock divider is 30 and the decimal part of the clock divider is 0.015625. Therefore, the clock divider is 30.015625.
  • UART baud rate = Internal bus frequency/(16 x Clock divider) = Internal bus frequency/(16 x 30.015625)

Member.name: banddivfrac
Member.description: Clock divider corresponding to the decimal part of the baud rate All bits are cleared during reset.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_LCR_H
RegisterGroup.description: a transfer mode control register. The registers UART_LCR_H, UART_IBRD, and UART_FBRD constitute a 30-bit register. If UART_IBRD and UART_FBRD are updated, UART_LCR_H must also be updated.

Member.name: sps
Member.description:
Parity select
When bit 1, bit 2, and bit 7 of this register are set to 1, the parity bit is 0 during transmission and detection.
When bit 1 and bit 7 are set to 1 and bit 2 is set to 0, the parity bit is 1 during transmission and detection.
When bit 1, bit 2, and bit 7 are cleared, the stick parity bit is disabled.

Member.name: wlen
Member.description:
Count of bits in a transmitted or received frame
00: 5 bits
01: 6 bits
10: 7 bits
11: 8 bits

Member.name: fen
Member.description:
TX/RX FIFO enable
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: stp2
Member.description:
Whether a 2-bit stop bit exists at the end of a transmitted frame
0: There is no 2-bit stop bit at the end of the transmitted frame.
1: There is a 2-bit stop bit at the end of the transmitted frame.
The RX logic does not check for the 2-bit stop bit during data reception.

Member.name: eps
Member.description:
Parity bit select during data transmission and reception
0: The odd parity bit is generated or checked during data transmission and reception.
1: The even parity bit is generated or checked during data transmission and reception.
This bit is invalid when UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0.

Member.name: pen
Member.description:
Parity check enable
0: The parity check is disabled.
1: The parity bit is generated at the TX end and checked at the RX end.

Member.name: brk
Member.description:
TX break
0: invalid
1: After the current data transmission is complete, the UTXD outputs low level continuously.
Note: This bit must retain 1 for at least two full frames to ensure that the break command is executed properly. In normal cases, this bit must be set to 0.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_CR
RegisterGroup.description: a UART control register.To configure UART_CR, perform the following steps:Write 0 to UART_CR[uarten] to disable the UART.Wait until the current data transmission or reception is complete.Set UART_LCR_H[fen] to 0.Configure UART_CR.Write 1 to UART_CR[uarten] to enable the UART.----End

Member.name: ctsen
Member.description:
CTS hardware flow control enable
0: disabled
1: enabled. Data can be transmitted only when the nUARTCTS signal is valid.

Member.name: rtsen
Member.description:
RTS hardware flow control enable
0: disabled
1: enabled. The data RX request can be sent only when the RX FIFO has free space.

Member.name: rts
Member.description:
Request TX
This bit is the inversion of the status output signal nUARTRTS of the UART modem.
0: The output signal is retained.
1: The output signal is 0.

Member.name: dtr
Member.description:
Data TX ready
This bit is the inversion of the status output signal nUARTDTR of the UART modem.
0: The output signal is retained.
1: The output signal is 0.

Member.name: rxe
Member.description:
UART RX enable
0: disabled
1: enabled
If the UART is disabled during data reception, the current data reception is stopped abnormally.

Member.name: txe
Member.description:
UART TX enable
0: disabled
1: enabled
If the UART is disabled during data transmission, the current data transmission is stopped abnormally.

Member.name: lbe
Member.description:
Loopback enable
0: disabled
1: The UARTTXD output is looped back to UARTRXD.

Member.name: uarten
Member.description:
UART enable
0: disabled
1: enabled
If the UART is disabled during data reception and transmission, the current data transfer ends before data is transmitted and received completely.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_IFLS
RegisterGroup.description: an interrupt FIFO threshold selection register. It is used to set the threshold for triggering the FIFO interrupt (UART_TXINTR or UART_RXINTR).

Member.name: rxiflsel
Member.description:
RX interrupt FIFO threshold. An RX interrupt is triggered when any of the following conditions is met:
000: RX FIFO ≥ 1/8 full
001: RX FIFO ≥ 1/4 full
010: RX FIFO ≥ 1/2 full
011: RX FIFO ≥ 3/4 full
100: RX FIFO ≥ 7/8 full
101?111: reserved

Member.name: txiflsel
Member.description:
TX interrupt FIFO threshold. A TX interrupt is triggered when any of the following conditions is met:
000: TX FIFO ≤ 1/8 full
001: TX FIFO ≤ 1/4 full
011: TX FIFO ≤ 3/4 full
010: TX FIFO ≤ 1/2 full
100: TX FIFO ≤ 7/8 full
101?111: reserved
